title: Using `wbwdi` to access World Development Indicators
text: wbwdi, can download indicator data multiple entities indicators single function call. function returns tidy data frame country, indicator, date, value columns. example, download GDP per capita total population Mexico, Canada, United States: need indicators entities, can pass "" entities parameter: want retrieve indicators wide format, can use corresponding parameter.

title: Seamless Access to World Bank World Development Indicators (WDI)
text: wbwdi R package access analyze World Bank’s World Development Indicators (WDI) using corresponding API. WDI provides 24,000 country region-level indicators various contexts. wbwdi enables users download, process work WDI series across multiple entities time periods. package designed work seamlessly International Debt Statistics (IDS) provided wbids package shares syntax sibling Python library wbwdi. follows principles econdataverse. package product Christoph Scheuch sponsored affiliated World Bank way, except use World Bank WDI API.

title: Seamless Access to World Bank World Development Indicators (WDI)
text: main function wdi_get() provides interface download multiple WDI series multiple entities specific date ranges. can also download indicators entities available dates: indicators also available monthly basis, e.g.: Similarly, also indicators available quarterly frequency, e.g.: can get list indicators supported WDI API via: can get list supported entities via: can also get list supported indicators entities another language, note everything seems translated languages: Check following function list supported languages: addition, can list supported regions, sources, topics lending types, respectively: want search specific keywords among indicators data sources, can use RStudio Positron data explorer. title: Seamless Access to World Bank World Development Indicators (WDI)
text: important differences existing packages wbwdi designed () narrow focus World Bank Development Indicators, (ii) consistent interface R packages (e.g., wbids), (iii) MIT license, (iv) shared interface Python libraries (e.g., wbwdi). wbwdi also refrains using cached data approach frequently leads problems users due outdated caches uses httr2 manage API requests parse responses. specifically, differences existing CRAN releases (apart interface design) : WDI: uses cached data default, allow downloading meta data WDI API (e.g., languages, sources, topics), GPL-3 license, neither use httr httr2 requests. worldbank: narrow focus includes Poverty Inequality Platform Finances One API. wbstats: uses cached data default, use httr2.

what: Internal function to perform API requests to the World Bank API — perform_request
title: Internal function to perform API requests to the World Bank API — perform_request
text: function constructs sends request specified World Bank API resource, options specify language, number results per page, date range, data source. also supports paginated requests progress tracking.

title: Internal function to perform API requests to the World Bank API — perform_request
code: perform_request(   resource,   language = NULL,   per_page = 10000L,   date = NULL,   most_recent_only = NULL,   source = NULL,   progress = FALSE,   base_url = "https://api.worldbank.org/v2/",   max_tries = 10L )

title: Internal function to perform API requests to the World Bank API — perform_request
text: resource character string specifying resource endpoint World Bank API (e.g., "incomeLevels", "lendingTypes"). language character string specifying language code API response. Defaults NULL. per_page integer specifying number results per page API. Defaults 10,000. Must value 1 32,500. date character string specifying date range data retrieved (e.g., "2000:2020"). NULL (default), date filtering applied. source character string specifying data source API request. NULL (default), specific source selected. progress logical value indicating whether display progress bar paginated requests. Defaults FALSE. base_url character string specifying base URL World Bank API (default "https://api.worldbank.org/v2"). max_tries integer specifying number attempts API request.

title: Internal function to perform API requests to the World Bank API — perform_request
text: list containing parsed JSON response API. response contains multiple pages, results combined single list. API returns error, provides relevant error message documentation.

title: Internal function to perform API requests to the World Bank API — perform_request
text: internal helper function constructs request URL using base URL, language, resource, optional parameters (date source), performs API request. paginated results, iterates pages consolidates data single output. function handles API errors, providing detailed error messages available.

what: wbwdi: Seamless Access to World Bank World Development Indicators (WDI) — wbwdi-package
title: wbwdi: Seamless Access to World Bank World Development Indicators (WDI) — wbwdi-package
text: Access analyze World Bank’s World Development Indicators (WDI) using corresponding API https://datahelpdesk.worldbank.org/knowledgebase/articles/889392---indicators-api-documentation. WDI provides 24,000 country region-level indicators various contexts. 'wbwdi' enables users download, process work WDI series across multiple countries, aggregates, time periods.

title: wbwdi: Seamless Access to World Bank World Development Indicators (WDI) — wbwdi-package
text: Maintainer: Christoph Scheuch christoph@tidy-intelligence.com (ORCID) [copyright holder]

what: Download World Bank indicator data for specific entities and time periods — wdi_get
title: Download World Bank indicator data for specific entities and time periods — wdi_get
text: function retrieves indicator data World Bank API specified set entities indicators. user can specify one indicators, date range, options tailor request. data processed returned tidy format, including country, indicator, date, value fields.

title: Download World Bank indicator data for specific entities and time periods — wdi_get
code: wdi_get(   entities,   indicators,   start_year = NULL,   end_year = NULL,   most_recent_only = FALSE,   frequency = "annual",   language = "en",   per_page = 10000L,   progress = TRUE,   source = NULL,   format = "long" )

title: Download World Bank indicator data for specific entities and time periods — wdi_get
text: entities character vector ISO 2 ISO 3-country codes, "" retrieve data entities. indicators character vector specifying one World Bank indicators download (e.g., c("NY.GDP.PCAP.KD", "SP.POP.TOTL")). start_year Optional integer. starting date data year. end_year Optional integer. ending date data year. most_recent_only logical value indicating whether download recent value. case TRUE, overrides start_year end_year. Defaults FALSE. frequency character string specifying frequency data ("annual", "quarter", "month"). Defaults "annual". language character string specifying language request, see wdi_get_languages. Defaults "en". per_page integer specifying number results per page API. Defaults 10,000. progress logical value indicating whether show progress messages data download parsing. Defaults TRUE. source integer value specifying data source, see wdi_get_sources. format character value specifying whether data returned "long" "wide" format. Defaults "long".

title: Download World Bank indicator data for specific entities and time periods — wdi_get
text: tibble following columns: entity_id ISO 3-country code country aggregate data retrieved. indicator_id ID indicator (e.g., "NY.GDP.PCAP.KD"). year year indicator data integer. quarter Optional. quarter indicator data integer. month Optional. month indicator data integer. value value indicator given country date.

title: Download World Bank indicator data for specific entities and time periods — wdi_get
text: function constructs request URL World Bank API, retrieves relevant data given entities indicators, processes response tidy format. user can optionally specify date range, function handle requests multiple pages necessary. progress parameter TRUE, messages displayed request parsing process. function supports downloading multiple indicators sending individual API requests indicator combining results single tidy data frame.

what: Download all countries and regions from the World Bank API — wdi_get_entities
title: Download all countries and regions from the World Bank API — wdi_get_entities
text: function retrieves information entities (countries regions) World Bank API. returns tibble containing various details entity's ID, ISO2 code, name, region information, lending type, capital city, coordinates.

title: Download all countries and regions from the World Bank API — wdi_get_entities
code: wdi_get_entities(language = "en", per_page = 1000)

title: Download all countries and regions from the World Bank API — wdi_get_entities
text: language character string specifying language API response. Defaults "en" (English). supported options include "es" (Spanish), "fr" (French), others depending API. per_page integer specifying number records fetch per request. Defaults 1000.

title: Download all countries and regions from the World Bank API — wdi_get_entities
text: tibble following columns: entity_id character string representing entity's unique identifier. entity_name character string name entity. entity_iso2code character string ISO2 country code. entity_type character string type entity ("country" "region"). region_id character string representing region's unique identifier. region_name character string name region. region_iso2code character string ISO2 region code. admin_region_id character string representing administrative region's unique identifier. admin_region_name character string name administrative region. admin_region_iso2code character string ISO2 code administrative region. income_level_id character string representing entity's income level. income_level_name character string name income level. income_level_iso2code character string ISO2 code income level. lending_type_id character string representing lending type's unique identifier. lending_type_name character string name lending type. lending_type_iso2code character string ISO2 code lending type. capital_city character string name capital city. longitude numeric value longitude entity. latitude numeric value latitude entity.

title: Download all countries and regions from the World Bank API — wdi_get_entities
text: function sends request World Bank API retrieve data supported entities specified language. data processed tidy format includes information country, ISO code, capital city, geographical coordinates, additional metadata regions, income levels, lending types.

title: wbwdi 1.0.0
text: Changed wording functions parameters “geography”” “entity”” compliance upcoming econid release.

title: wbwdi 0.2.1
text: Enhanced wdi_get() function support monthly quarterly frequencies specific indicators, allowing granular data analysis. Ensured consistent interface wbids package, enabling seamless integration working World Development Indicators International Debt Statistics. Addressed problems API requests ensure reliable data fetching handling responses. Provided detailed examples use cases package vignettes guide users effectively utilizing package’s features. Improved function documentation clearly explain parameters, return values, usage examples. Added most_recent_only parameter wdi_get() support upcoming econtools package.

title: wbwdi 0.1.0
text: Initial release includes functions wdi_get(), wdi_get_topics(), wdi_get_sources(), wdi_get_regions(), wdi_get_lending_types(), wdi_get_languages(), wdi_get_indicators(), wdi_get_income_levels(), wdi_get_geographies()
